instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWGD? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD. When you see ALL_SYS_PWGD, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON â€“ CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .
definitions.PM_S0_PGOOD: What is PM_S0_PGOOD?  PM_S0_PGOOD is created when CPUVR_PGOOD and ALL_SYS_PWRGD are present and branches off to become PM_PCH_PWROK. PM_S0_PGOOD and SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD are necessary to create SYS_PWROK_R and PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan speed one turn and off
threads.message:
Hi,
i have this board liquid spill near SMC. I put the board in a ultra sonic cleaner, now i clean but can start, just fan and stop.
i change the SMC, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> (because <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is low 12,26, now 12,57). i try the board with original charger 85W.
I have the <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWGD</SIGNAL>=3,34V just few seconds and fall when fan stop.
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> 17/18=3ohm and 27/28=20ohm
do you have any idea, where i can find the problem?
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan speed one turn and off
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR>/03 as first step.
Do you get voltage on all big coils (pulse at least)?
Try to start in SMC bypass, still turns off?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan speed one turn and off
threads.message:
I'm working on a similar problem.  

Does the fan start smoothly or do you have a stutter? 
Is the fan spinning at full speed - loud

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan speed one turn and off
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> = 150K
<RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR>=182K
L7330 = 1,5V and fall
L7260 = 5V and fall
L7220 = 3V3 always
L7630 = 1V and fall
L7100 =1V and fall
L7550 = nothing
L7510 = nothing
L7520 = nothing
SMC Bypass not work, same problem turn fan normally and shutdown

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan speed one turn and off
threads.message: acowan the fan start normally and stop after 1second

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan speed one turn and off
threads.message:
"L7510 = nothing
L7520 = nothing"
Nor even pulsing?

Also check for pulse (at least) at pin 4 of <CHIP>U2650</CHIP>/60.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan speed one turn and off
threads.message:
sorry, i have 0V, no pulse.
<CHIP>U2650</CHIP> pin 4 <SIGNAL>PM_S0_PGOOD</SIGNAL>=0V no pulse
<CHIP>U2660</CHIP> pin 4 <SIGNAL>SYS_PWROK_R</SIGNAL>=0V no pulse

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan speed one turn and off
threads.message:
Monitor all voltages on pages 71/72.
Check for short all them.

Did you solder another SMC pulled from 3115 board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan speed one turn and off
threads.message:
I check all voltage on page 71/72, all pulse at the good voltage but after fall, some voltage don't fall at 0v.
No short find on this voltage.
Yes i keep the smc on other same board 3115.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan speed one turn and off
threads.message:
Try known good BIOS.
First check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and traces (page 47).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan speed one turn and off
threads.message:
i check all SPI resistors seems all good and trace too.
I check with scope all the signals on <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, all signal communicate but not on pin 3 & 7. is it normal?
i change the bios with good bios same problem and i clean me of the original with cmizapper same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan speed one turn and off
threads.message:
Check all voltages from pages 71/72; any pulse at least?
Also check for short all them.

Test the board alone, nothing connected, only charger...
